definition: to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Some groups even fought one another.
sentences.chinese: 一些組織甚至自相殘殺。

sentences.english: So they are still capable of drawing back from a fratricidal war.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們仍有能力免於經歷這場自相殘殺。

sentences.english: No one expects us to choose sides in internecine mommy battles.
sentences.chinese: 沒人期待自相殘殺的媽媽們戰鬥中選擇離場。

sentences.english: Tyrannosaurus Rex may have been a cannibal, new evidence suggests.
sentences.chinese: 有新證據證明霸王龍可能會自相殘殺。

sentences.english: A grisly period of internecine war and cannibalism seems to have followed.
sentences.chinese: 一段可怕的內戰時期和自相殘殺的時期似乎接踵而至。

sentences.english: On several occasions, the Shan even took up arms against each other.
sentences.chinese: 在一些場合，撣族甚至拿起武器自相殘殺。

sentences.english: Finally, the fratricidal price wars led to the short-lived brand of Pharmaceuticals in China.
sentences.chinese: 最後，自相殘殺的價格戰導致中國藥品品牌的短命。

sentences.english: And when they had finished with the inhabitants of Seir, they began to destroy each other.
sentences.chinese: 殲滅了色依爾山地居民以後，他們又自相殘殺。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: war of words
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
moral bankruptcy/moral degeneracy
verbal sparring/duel of words
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
bane of one's existence/vile spawn
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
a spy/a crafty person
regular army/standing army
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
